title: Dakos Salad
summary: Traditional Cretan salad with barley rusks, tomatoes, and mizithra cheese.

items: 4 barley rusks (paximadi) or thick slices of toasted whole grain bread
1 cup mizithra or feta cheese, crumbled

instructions.value: If using barley rusks, briefly moisten them under running water or dip in a bowl of water for 2-3 seconds. They should soften slightly but remain crunchy in the center.
Place rusks on individual serving plates.
Grate tomatoes using the large holes of a box grater, discarding the skin. Season with salt.
Spoon the grated tomato over each rusk, allowing it to soak in slightly.
Top with crumbled cheese, sliced onions, olives, and cucumber.
Drizzle generously with olive oil and vinegar.
Sprinkle with oregano, salt, and pepper.
Serve immediately while the base still has some crunch.

tips_and_notes: The key is the quality of the tomatoes - use the ripest, most flavorful ones you can find
Don't over-soak the rusks - they should be slightly crunchy
This is traditionally served as a light lunch or appetizer in Crete
